body_html:
@josh11b I believe anyone seeing the README file would have a Markdown interpreter, no? Unless they're reading in plain text, then it's safe to assume they will be able to follow links by themselves.

Relative links will alow users who have an offline copy to continue working, reading their copies of the docs, instead of going online to find the same resource.
body_text:
@josh11b I believe anyone seeing the README file would have a Markdown interpreter, no? Unless they're reading in plain text, then it's safe to assume they will be able to follow links by themselves.
Relative links will alow users who have an offline copy to continue working, reading their copies of the docs, instead of going online to find the same resource.
body:
@josh11b I believe anyone seeing the README file would have a Markdown interpreter, no? Unless they're reading in plain text, then it's safe to assume they will be able to follow links by themselves.

Relative links will alow users who have an offline copy to continue working, reading their copies of the docs, instead of going online to find the same resource.
